page.title: 11CHILDERDITCH HALL FARM.
page.content: Childerditch Hall Farm belongs to P.W., E.& J.H.Ford. There are one thousand acres, 300 acres on the north side of the Arterial Road and 700 acres on the south side. On the northern area crops grown are Oil Seed Rape and Winter Wheat and some Rough Pasture. On the southern area crops grown are Oil Seed Rape, Winter Wheat, Potatoes and Peas. The latter are collected for canning. Mr. Ford and his family live in Childerditch Hall. Near to the Hall 25 acres of land form Childerditch Industrial Estate. There are varied units and it is an International freight collecting point distributing goods to Germany, Holland, Belgium, Greece and South Africa. Trades involved are - Steel Mouldings, Concrete Forms, Clothing, Car Inspection.
